pros: Support staff. Benefits. Pay for entry level providers.
cons: Raises could be better. Scheduling staff could be trained better.

job_title: Medical Assistant in Belle Chasse, LA
pros: Benefits are good pay is good for just starting
cons: I have no complaints at the moment

job_title: Quality Assurance in New Orleans, LA
pros: Growing! Caring for a lot of Louisiana's most vulnerable.
cons: Needing more streamlined care and professional providers.

pros:
Company's belief in it's mission statement is genuine.  Administration sincerely cares about it's employees and the communities in which they serve.  There is potential to move ahead in your career. 
Chief of Operations is awesome! He's hard working, professional, and fair to all employees!!! He is also an understanding & compassionate person.
cons: Poor communication to lower level employees who are not located in administration.  Poor follow through on clinic issues.  IT department is extremely slow and employees lack motivation to resolve issues promptly.

job_title: Psych Nurse Practitioner in Luling, LA
pros: Possible to qualify for federal tuition reimbursement. Regular business hours with weekends and  holidays off. No call for psych providers.
cons: Grossly disorganized. No accountability to ancillary staff. Lack of support from management.  The don't screen the psych patients so beware of drug seekers and patients that are inappropriate for the practice.  They make no accommodations for employee satisfaction.  They do not value patient care, just increasing the number of patients seen by providers without concern for suffering quality. They have a history of firing employees without notice or cause.

pros: flexibility and a few good people I   met along the way
cons: Does not value hard work and dedication to proving care to the patients they serve.  Their mission statement means nothing to them and they do not live by what it says.  Management is all about nepatism and you can see how many people got their job because of it.  They do not value their providers at all because the pay is below average and there is no reassurance that your license is protected because there is no accountability at any level.  If you ask for anything to be done do not expect that it will get done any time soon if at all.  They say they value continued education but try to take a day off even when you have PTO and often you have to find your own coverage to get it approved.  Emails are ignored and phone etiquette is absent.  You can say that overall management is absent and just getting their pay check.

pros: If you are lazy and incompetent this is a good place for you
cons: Everything. With their practice there is a good chance you will lose your license.
